content.description: This is the crunched up sit start into Sunset Face. It adds two crimpy moves
content.location: Sit just right of the center of the West face

content.description:
Sit start in the middle of the west face. Go straight up using only face holds, no touching any of the corners or top edge until you top out at the highest point.

 There's not really a good way to get off the boulder and your best bet is to down climb.
Sit start with very minimal feet. Bump right hand to 1/4 pad crimp, and from here fire for the mini ledge with the left hand, then traverse into the west face and climb straight up the the top.
content.location: sit down at the base of the SW arreteÂ

content.description: Sit Start. Hard compression move at the start, throw a left heel hook and fire for the dish left handed. From there follow the ridge to the top on mediocre feet. Don't touch the right edge.
content.location: Sit at the bottom of the NW arrete

content.description: This is a loop traverse around the green egg boulder. I started at the SW arrete and traverse into the south face of the boulder, keep going until you have completed a full circle. Never touch the floor, never touch the top.

This is the direct line through the slabby east face of the Green Egg. Good holds, a tad run out at the end. Don't fall, there is no reason to.

 At the topout, it's safest to climb over the top and decent the west face which is a bit shorter
content.location: The first line you spot coming up from the trail

content.description: Sit start on the northwest arete, up the corner and top out. Short and easy but a cool starting hold.
Short but pretty compression boulder that climbs the South face of the Green Egg boulder. A right heel hook will make you feel better about that 30 degree landing...
content.location: Start low at the South face, ideally get your partner to keep your pad in place

content.description: Very aesthetic 18ft tall 'egg'. Perched on a couple of shelves between the trees. Has a flat east face, but can be climbed from various sides
